Package chess

Class Chess

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Chess
  • public class Chess
extends java.lang.Object

    Chess Game

    The chess program simulates a chess match between two people. It takes a move as an input and then prints the chess board with the implemented move.

    • Method Detail

      • iterate1

        public static java.lang.String iterate1​(char one,
                                        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> keys)
        This method is used to calculate whether the opposing player's King is in check or in checkmate after a move has been performed.
        Parameters:
        one - the opposing player's king color in character form
        keys - a map that contains all of the board's pieces
        Returns:
        a string that tells whether the opposing player's King is in check or in checkmate

      • iterate

        public static java.lang.String iterate​(char one,
                                       java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> keys)
        This method is used to calculate whether the opposing player's King is in check or in checkmate after a move has been performed. It further prints the result to the terminal if the opposing player's king is in check or in checkmate
        Parameters:
        one - the opposing player's king color in character form
        keys - a map that contains all of the board's pieces
        Returns:
        a string that tells whether the opposing player's King is in check or in checkmate

      • possibilities

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> possibilities​(java.lang.String start,
                                                                  java.lang.String value,
                                                                  java.lang.String end,
                                                                  java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> keys)
        This method is used to calculate all of the possible moves for a given piece
        Parameters:
        start - the starting location for the piece
        value - the value of the piece at the starting location
        end - the ending location for the piece
        keys - a map that contains all of the board's pieces
        Returns:
        a list of all possible moves for a given input

      • validMove

        public static boolean validMove​(java.lang.String start,
                                java.lang.String end,
                                java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> keys)
        This method is used to calculate whether it is possible for a given piece to execute a move
        Parameters:
        start - the starting location for the piece
        end - the ending location for the piece
        keys - a map that contains all of the board's pieces
        Returns:
        a boolean that tells whether a given move can be executed

      • draw

        public static void draw​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> c)
        This method is used to print out the chess board after a move has been executed
        Parameters:
        c - an ordered list of type string that contains the contents of the board

      • sort

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> sort​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> f)
        This method is used to sort a map into a list according to the order of the chess board
        Parameters:
        f - an unordered map that contains the values of the chess board
        Returns:
        a ordered list that contains the values of the chess board

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        This is the main method which draws the initial board and runs the loop that queries both players for their moves.
        Parameters:
        args - Unused.
